title: Making Elaborate Improvised Compass with Pivot
brief: Construct a more sophisticated improvised compass using a needle, container, and pivot system.
steps: Step 1: Break a sewing needle in half - one half for pointer, one half for pivot.
Step 2: Push the pivot half through the bottom center of a nonmetallic container, flush with bottom.
Step 3: Attach the center of the pointer half to a pen's silver tip using glue, tree sap, or melted plastic.
Step 4: Magnetize one end of the pointer needle using silk, hair, or magnet stroking.
Step 5: Cut center out of container lid and waterproof it.
Step 6: Rest the pointer on the pivot point inside the container.
warnings: Pivot must not interfere with container lid.
Pointer must be perfectly balanced on pivot point.
Container must be nonmetallic to avoid magnetic interference.
